lexUnit.name: plenty.n

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: a large or sufficient amount or quantity; more than enough.

sentence.text: In that first quiet week of the ` phoney " war I had plenty to think about .
It is a lively superbly well-equipped resort where there is always plenty to do -- from horse-riding to go-karting , tennis to mini-golf .
Give the horse plenty to think about so that he concentrates on his work rather than other exciting stimuli .
Marie bought loads of cat food before she left , so there 's plenty for him .
` There 's plenty for everyone . "
Corporate America has plenty of problems .
But it seems there are some that still have plenty of money . "
Even if camping is still a complete turn-off for her there are plenty of creative ways to enjoy the outdoors without camping .
I am always punctual and on the platform in plenty of time , but it is seldom the right platform .
This procedure provides plenty of room for fudging the figures and building in arbitrary assumptions .
It too had plenty of time to make its dispositions .
He reminded me that there were plenty in his early lifetime .
But there are plenty of reasons why cash might be needed in a hurry .
But at least I have plenty of time to think while I 'm driving -- I use the time to plan ahead . "
It will be much quieter and more pleasant and there 's always plenty to drink .
Drink plenty of water and calorie-free drinks
“ Keep him warm and give him plenty to drink .
They should also be encouraged to take plenty of exercise and eat a good healthy diet .
There were plenty of fish to eat in Egypt , and fruit and vegetables -- and no shortage of water .
Mrs Hardman loves animals , and there 's plenty for him to eat , lots of grass to run on .
It could point to plenty of ailments that the Spanish economic rejuvenation so far has failed to cure .
And young graduates are not leaving now -- multinational corporations and European Union investment mean there are plenty of opportunities for them at home .

Bestowed with plenty of the invaluable pioneer spirit that characterizes Las Vegas to this day , Gass redirected his life by picking up where the Mormons left off -- at least when it came to ranching and farming .
